parts:
• ID: {{ac-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ac-1_smt.a}} - Develops, documents, and disseminates to {{ ac-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.a.1}} - An access control policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the access control policy and associated access controls; and
    • item: {{ac-1_smt.b}} - Reviews and updates the current:
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.b.1}} - Access control policy {{ ac-1_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.b.2}} - Access control procedures {{ ac-1_prm_3 }}.
  • ID: {{ac-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{ac-1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1}} - develops and documents an access control policy that addresses:
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.a}} - purpose;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.b}} - scope;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.c}} - roles;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.d}} - responsibilities;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.e}} - management commitment;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.f}} - coordination among organizational entities;
          • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.1.g}} - compliance;
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the access control policy are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.1_obj.3}} - disseminates the access control policy to organization-defined personnel or roles;
      • objective: {{ac-1.a.2_obj}}
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.2_obj.1}} - develops and documents procedures to facilitate the implementation of the access control policy and associated access control controls;
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.2_obj.2}} - defines personnel or roles to whom the procedures are to be disseminated;
        • objective: {{ac-1.a.2_obj.3}} - disseminates the procedures to organization-defined personnel or roles;
    • objective: {{ac-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ac-1.b.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{ac-1.b.1_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review and update the current access control policy;
        • objective: {{ac-1.b.1_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current access control policy with the organization-defined frequency;
      • objective: {{ac-1.b.2_obj}}

        • objective: {{ac-1.b.2_obj.2}} - reviews and updates the current access control procedures with the organization-defined frequency.

title: Account Management

parts:
• ID: {{ac-2_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.a}} - Identifies and selects the following types of information system accounts to support organizational missions/business functions: {{ ac-2_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.b}} - Assigns account managers for information system accounts;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.c}} - Establishes conditions for group and role membership;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.d}} - Specifies authorized users of the information system, group and role membership, and access authorizations (i.e., privileges) and other attributes (as required) for each account;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.e}} - Requires approvals by {{ ac-2_prm_2 }} for requests to create information system accounts;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.f}} - Creates, enables, modifies, disables, and removes information system accounts in accordance with {{ ac-2_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.g}} - Monitors the use of information system accounts;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.h}} - Notifies account managers:
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.h.1}} - When accounts are no longer required;
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.h.2}} - When users are terminated or transferred; and
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.h.3}} - When individual information system usage or need-to-know changes;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.i}} - Authorizes access to the information system based on:
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.i.1}} - A valid access authorization;
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.i.2}} - Intended system usage; and
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.i.3}} - Other attributes as required by the organization or associated missions/business functions;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.j}} - Reviews accounts for compliance with account management requirements {{ ac-2_prm_4 }}; and
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.k}} - Establishes a process for reissuing shared/group account credentials (if deployed) when individuals are removed from the group.
  • ID: {{ac-2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:

      • objective: {{ac-2.a_obj.2}} - identifies and selects organization-defined information system account types to support organizational missions/business functions;

    • objective: {{ac-2.c_obj}} - establishes conditions for group and role membership;

    • objective: {{ac-2.e_obj}}

    • objective: {{ac-2.f_obj}}

title: Mandatory Access Control
parameters:
Parameters
{{ac-3.3_prm_1}}: organization-defined mandatory access control policy
{{ac-3.3_prm_2}}: organization-defined subjects
{{ac-3.3_prm_3}}: organization-defined privileges (i.e., they are trusted subjects)
parts:
• ID: {{ac-3.3_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system enforces {{ ac-3.3_prm_1 }} over all subjects and objects where the policy:
    • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.a}} - Is uniformly enforced across all subjects and objects within the boundary of the information system;
    • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b}} - Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.1}} - Passing the information to unauthorized subjects or objects;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.2}} - Granting its privileges to other subjects;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.3}} - Changing one or more security attributes on subjects, objects, the information system, or information system components;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.4}} - Choosing the security attributes and attribute values to be associated with newly created or modified objects; or
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.5}} - Changing the rules governing access control; and
    • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.c}} - Specifies that {{ ac-3.3_prm_2 }} may explicitly be granted {{ ac-3.3_prm_3 }} such that they are not limited by some or all of the above constraints.
  • ID: {{ac-3.3_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if:
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.1}} - the organization defines mandatory access control policies to be enforced over all subjects and objects;
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.2}} - the organization defines subjects over which organization-defined mandatory access control policies are to be enforced;
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.3}} - the organization defines objects over which organization-defined mandatory access control policies are to be enforced;
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.4}} - the organization defines subjects that may explicitly be granted privileges such that they are not limited by the constraints specified elsewhere within this control;
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.5}} - the organization defines privileges that may be granted to organization-defined subjects;
    • objective: {{ac-3.3_obj.6}} - the information system enforces organization-defined mandatory access control policies over all subjects and objects where the policy specifies that:
      • objective: {{ac-3.3.a_obj.6}} - the policy is uniformly enforced across all subjects and objects within the boundary of the information system;

    • item: {{ia-5_smt.c}} - Ensuring that authenticators have sufficient strength of mechanism for their intended use;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.d}} - Establishing and implementing administrative procedures for initial authenticator distribution, for lost/compromised or damaged authenticators, and for revoking authenticators;

title: Password-based Authentication
parameters:
Parameters
{{ia-5.1_prm_1}}: organization-defined requirements for case sensitivity, number of characters, mix of upper-case letters, lower-case letters, numbers, and special characters, including minimum requirements for each type
{{ia-5.1_prm_2}}: organization-defined number
{{ia-5.1_prm_3}}: organization-defined numbers for lifetime minimum, lifetime maximum
{{ia-5.1_prm_4}}: organization-defined number
parts:
• ID: {{ia-5.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system, for password-based authentication:
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.a}} - Enforces minimum password complexity of {{ ia-5.1_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.b}} - Enforces at least the following number of changed characters when new passwords are created: {{ ia-5.1_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.c}} - Stores and transmits only cryptographically-protected passwords;
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.d}} - Enforces password minimum and maximum lifetime restrictions of {{ ia-5.1_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.e}} - Prohibits password reuse for {{ ia-5.1_prm_4 }} generations; and
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.f}} - Allows the use of a temporary password for system logons with an immediate change to a permanent password.
  • ID: {{ia-5.1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if, for password-based authentication:
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj.1}} - the organization defines requirements for case sensitivity;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj.2}} - the organization defines requirements for number of characters;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj.3}} - the organization defines requirements for the mix of upper-case letters, lower-case letters, numbers and special characters;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj.4}} - the organization defines minimum requirements for each type of character;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.a_obj.5}} - the information system enforces minimum password complexity of organization-defined requirements for case sensitivity, number of characters, mix of upper-case letters, lower-case letters, numbers, and special characters, including minimum requirements for each type;
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.b_obj.1}} - the organization defines a minimum number of changed characters to be enforced when new passwords are created;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.b_obj.2}} - the information system enforces at least the organization-defined minimum number of characters that must be changed when new passwords are created;
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.c_obj}} - the information system stores and transmits only encrypted representations of passwords;
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.d_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.d_obj.1}} - the organization defines numbers for password minimum lifetime restrictions to be enforced for passwords;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.d_obj.2}} - the organization defines numbers for password maximum lifetime restrictions to be enforced for passwords;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.d_obj.3}} - the information system enforces password minimum lifetime restrictions of organization-defined numbers for lifetime minimum;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.d_obj.4}} - the information system enforces password maximum lifetime restrictions of organization-defined numbers for lifetime maximum;
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.e_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.e_obj.1}} - the organization defines the number of password generations to be prohibited from password reuse;
      • objective: {{ia-5.1.e_obj.2}} - the information system prohibits password reuse for the organization-defined number of generations; and
    • objective: {{ia-5.1.f_obj}} - the information system allows the use of a temporary password for system logons with an immediate change to a permanent password.
assessment:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing password-based authenticator management capability

title: Pki-based Authentication
parts:
• ID: {{ia-5.2_smt}}, Name: statement - The information system, for PKI-based authentication:
    • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.a}} - Validates certifications by constructing and verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor including checking certificate status information;
    • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.b}} - Enforces authorized access to the corresponding private key;
    • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.c}} - Maps the authenticated identity to the account of the individual or group; and
    • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.d}} - Implements a local cache of revocation data to support path discovery and validation in case of inability to access revocation information via the network.
  • ID: {{ia-5.2_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the information system, for PKI-based authentication:
    • objective: {{ia-5.2.a_obj}}
      • objective: {{ia-5.2.a_obj.1}} - validates certifications by constructing a certification path to an accepted trust anchor;
      • objective: {{ia-5.2.a_obj.2}} - validates certifications by verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor;
      • objective: {{ia-5.2.a_obj.3}} - includes checking certificate status information when constructing and verifying the certification path;
    • objective: {{ia-5.2.b_obj}} - enforces authorized access to the corresponding private key;
    • objective: {{ia-5.2.c_obj}} - maps the authenticated identity to the account of the individual or group; and
    • objective: {{ia-5.2.d_obj}} - implements a local cache of revocation data to support path discovery and validation in case of inability to access revocation information via the network.
assessment:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing PKI-based, authenticator management capability

      • objective: {{ir-8.a.3_obj}} - provides a high-level approach for how the incident response capability fits into the overall organization;

        • objective: {{ir-8.a.4_obj.2}} - size;

Parameters

parts:
• ID: {{ir-9_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization responds to information spills by:

    • item: {{ir-9_smt.b}} - Alerting {{ ir-9_prm_1 }} of the information spill using a method of communication not associated with the spill;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.c}} - Isolating the contaminated information system or system component;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.d}} - Eradicating the information from the contaminated information system or component;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.e}} - Identifying other information systems or system components that may have been subsequently contaminated; and
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.f}} - Performing other {{ ir-9_prm_2 }}.

      • objective: {{ir-9.b_obj.3}} - responds to information spills by alerting organization-defined personnel of the information spill using a method of communication not associated with the spill;
    • objective: {{ir-9.c_obj}} - responds to information spills by isolating the contaminated information system;
    • objective: {{ir-9.d_obj}} - responds to information spills by eradicating the information from the contaminated information system;
    • objective: {{ir-9.e_obj}} - responds to information spills by identifying other information systems that may have been subsequently contaminated;
    • objective: {{ir-9.f_obj}}
      • objective: {{ir-9.f_obj.1}} - defines other actions to be performed in response to information spills; and
      • objective: {{ir-9.f_obj.2}} - responds to information spills by performing other organization-defined actions.

• ID: {{ma-5.1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{ma-5.1_smt.a}} - Implements procedures for the use of maintenance personnel that lack appropriate security clearances or are not U.S. citizens, that include the following requirements:
      • item: {{ma-5.1_smt.a.1}} - Maintenance personnel who do not have needed access authorizations, clearances, or formal access approvals are escorted and supervised during the performance of maintenance and diagnostic activities on the information system by approved organizational personnel who are fully cleared, have appropriate access authorizations, and are technically qualified;
      • item: {{ma-5.1_smt.a.2}} - Prior to initiating maintenance or diagnostic activities by personnel who do not have needed access authorizations, clearances or formal access approvals, all volatile information storage components within the information system are sanitized and all nonvolatile storage media are removed or physically disconnected from the system and secured; and
    • item: {{ma-5.1_smt.b}} - Develops and implements alternate security safeguards in the event an information system component cannot be sanitized, removed, or disconnected from the system.

        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.1_obj.1}} - are fully cleared;
        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.1_obj.2}} - have appropriate access authorizations;
        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.1_obj.3}} - are technically qualified;
      • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.2_obj}} - prior to initiating maintenance or diagnostic activities by personnel who do not have needed access authorizations, clearances, or formal access approvals:
        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.2_obj.1}} - all volatile information storage components within the information system are sanitized; and
        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.2_obj.2}} - all nonvolatile storage media are removed; or
        • objective: {{ma-5.1.a.2_obj.3}} - all nonvolatile storage media are physically disconnected from the system and secured; and
    • objective: {{ma-5.1.b_obj}} - develops and implements alternative security safeguards in the event an information system component cannot be sanitized, removed, or disconnected from the system.
assessment:

      • Organizational processes for managing maintenance personnel without appropriate access automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing alternative security safeguards automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing information storage component sanitization

title: Information Security Program Plan
parameters:
Parameters
{{pm-1_prm_1}}: organization-defined frequency
parts:
• ID: {{pm-1_smt}}, Name: statement - The organization:
    • item: {{pm-1_smt.a}} - Develops and disseminates an organization-wide information security program plan that:
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.1}} - Provides an overview of the requirements for the security program and a description of the security program management controls and common controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements;
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.2}} - Includes the identification and assignment of roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance;
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.3}} - Reflects coordination among organizational entities responsible for the different aspects of information security (i.e., technical, physical, personnel, cyber-physical); and
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.4}} - Is approved by a senior official with responsibility and accountability for the risk being incurred to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, and reputation), organizational assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation;
    • item: {{pm-1_smt.b}} - Reviews the organization-wide information security program plan {{ pm-1_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{pm-1_smt.c}} - Updates the plan to address organizational changes and problems identified during plan implementation or security control assessments; and
    • item: {{pm-1_smt.d}} - Protects the information security program plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.
  • ID: {{pm-1_obj}}, Name: objective - Determine if the organization:
    • objective: {{pm-1.a_obj}} - develops and disseminates an organization-wide information security program plan that:
      • objective: {{pm-1.a.1_obj}}
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.1_obj.1}} - provides an overview of the requirements for the security program;
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.1_obj.2}} - provides a description of the:
          • objective: {{pm-1.a.1_obj.2.a}} - security program management controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements;
          • objective: {{pm-1.a.1_obj.2.b}} - common controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements;
      • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj}} - includes the identification and assignment of:
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj.1}} - roles;
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj.2}} - responsibilities;
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj.3}} - management commitment;
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj.4}} - coordination among organizational entities;
        • objective: {{pm-1.a.2_obj.5}} - compliance;
      • objective: {{pm-1.a.3_obj}} - reflects coordination among organizational entities responsible for the different aspects of information security (i.e., technical, physical, personnel, cyber-physical);
      • objective: {{pm-1.a.4_obj}} - is approved by a senior official with responsibility and accountability for the risk being incurred to organizational operations, organizational assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation;
    • objective: {{pm-1.b_obj}}
      • objective: {{pm-1.b_obj.1}} - defines the frequency to review the security program plan for the information system;
      • objective: {{pm-1.b_obj.2}} - reviews the organization-wide information security program plan with the organization-defined frequency;
    • objective: {{pm-1.c_obj}} - updates the plan to address organizational:
      • objective: {{pm-1.c_obj.1}} - changes identified during plan implementation;
      • objective: {{pm-1.c_obj.2}} - changes identified during security control assessments;
      • objective: {{pm-1.c_obj.3}} - problems identified during plan implementation;
      • objective: {{pm-1.c_obj.4}} - problems identified during security control assessments;
    • objective: {{pm-1.d_obj}} - protects the information security program plan from unauthorized:
      • objective: {{pm-1.d_obj.1}} - disclosure; and
      • objective: {{pm-1.d_obj.2}} - modification.
assessment:
• Assessment
    • Assessment Type: TEST
      • Organizational processes for information security program plan development/review/update/approval automated mechanisms supporting and/or implementing the information security program plan
